TL;DR: A mediocre scifi and Yuri kinetic novel leaves your inner scifi nerd wanting more.

Okay, here goes a thumbs down - I read the thing, so I might as well type out a review out of it. I admit it, I read it only for the achievements and because I felt bored. It was entertaining but disappointing, but probably for different reasons for me than for most others.

A minor ambiguous spoilers warning: I discuss portions of the novel but hopefully in an ambiguous light.

Story time!
Not a fan of the category itself, this is apparently what's called a Yuri novel - a story about women in love with each other (either romantic or sexual). Consequently, this is the visual novel infamous for its lesbian sex scene. Whatever. What about the novel itself?

I can't say much about the graphical style. It looks good to me, pretty usual, and the music is pleasant but forgettable. It's a kinetic novel - no choices, just a linear story to follow.

The novel starts out as a high school story (IMHO boooring) but later turns into a science fiction story. The latter is frequently hinted at and that's how it got my interest: I crave scifi-fantasy literature so this winded up right in my alley. But I've given it thumbs down. Why?

The meat of the plot
You see, about 2/5 of the novel is about the high school and rebel thing that I find so dull. Sure, there's a mysterious detective dad who unfortunately ends up as a comedy relief. Then there's another 2/5 for the Yuri love and (if you turned the adult content on) sex stuff. Alright, that's what gets most people here. The scene isn't terribly graphic but the writing does get rather detailed and colourful. But it's only special since it's currently the only thing like that on Steam that's free (to my knowledge anyway).

But the last fifth or so is spent with the kind of awesome corny retro scifi theme I dig. The last part I found actually pretty interesting since I'm a huge nerd. Then it suddenly stops, just when it gets really interesting with the ominous space empire plot stuff.

Over already?!?
A read of 45 minutes, it's okay for a freebie but the sudden stop and a cliffhanger breaks it for me. Were this a first of a series it would be suitable as a demo and perhaps a thumbs up. Now, the scifi content is left mediocre and scarce - even underdeveloped. Perhaps I wasn't the target audience after all.

An extremely short VN with a thin plot and a quick lesbian adult scene as its main selling point.

GameplayBasic VN controls allowing auto-play, quick play, general settings and the ability to load and save the game in more than enough slots for the half an hour the game takes until completion.

StoryWe follow the protagonist and one other named character through a quick journey in which the main character, Azure, escapes her stereotypical boring everyday life by stumbling across a magical artifact that just happens to be related to an alien of royalty from outer space. They advance the quickest arranged marriage ever (for strengthening galactic politics) in order to excuse a single steamy sex scene, then the game very abruptly ends shortly after. There is then a moment of epilogue that is so vague it might as well have not been there. That's it.

GraphicsDecent character artwork as seen in the Steam screenshots are about as conclusive as you'll get, with backgrounds of the few locations used along the same lines. Most notably, the main character looks considerably younger than the 18 years the novel insists that she is, which is quite disturbing giving the adult scene. The latter scene includes very suggestive, but not explicit artwork.

MediaNothing special to report aside from standard BG music and the usual rolling credits. No voices, songs or cutscenes.

AchievementsThe first achievement is for reaching the ending, and the second is for completing the epilogue that lasts at most a few minutes after the ending. A walk in the park.

OverallFor once I might find myself obliged to agree with the various trolls in the review section and only recommend this game for its forced use of 18+ content. But since I don't feel this is a reasonable objective argument, the overall verdict remains a thumbs down. Even for a free game, there are much better alternatives out there.

It is only by the protagonist's marriage, the main plot elements, that this conflict has any hope of ending, a analogue to the kingship of Henry VII. Truely a work of great historiographic importance.

reviewText:
Let's start this review by saying this is 100% serious. I've seen many, many review saying just skip to the sex scene (It will spoken of in this review) and I feel the need to offer a review from a vetern of both VNs and yuri. Let's begin.

StoryObviously, the most important part of a visual novel.
The story in this one is, quite frankly, not the worst nor the best. It offers a somewhat original Idea, and the writing itself is rather good. There's a typo here and there, but for the most part, it's competently written. (Spoiler section will be at the end of this review) All-in-all, the story isn't anything to shout from the rooftops about, but it's enough to keep you going.
5/10

[h1[Characters[/h1]
Azure-Good god is she boring. I've honestly seen more personality from a plank. She has absolutely no character, though I suppose that's what the author intended. Still, I found myself kind of not caring at ALL about her through the whole game. For example, Azure's only personality trait is that she seems to hate school and reguarly ditches class early and often contemplates not going at all.

Sienna-I can honestly say Sienna is what kept me going. After she appeared, I found myself alot more interested. She actually gave me a chuckle and one point. She has alot more personality then azure, I mean ALOT more. I honestly say play it just for Sienna.

Azure's father-A minor character, with more personality then Azure. Quite frankly, they missed alot of oppertunities with him. He get's angry at azure for skipping school and he's a detective. This could have easily been longer had they exploired a few plot points with this guy.

As far as characters go, I was not impressed. The lead is boring and sienna doesn't appear till halfway through this rather short Visual Novel (Look at my play time.)

Characters 4/10

ArtThe other most important factor in a visual novel. The art in this one is rather typical, yet, I couldn't help but notice the detail they put into some images, and the complete lack of in others. CG involving characters is well done, but most everything falls pitifully short. As an example, during the sex scene, the images are so detailed to the point whre shadows from blinds are clearly visible. This shows alot of care put into these 2 scenes. To contrast, background images look rather shallow and generic. I swear, i've seen some of those backgrounds in other visual novels.
Art is something that is just as important as story in a visual novel. (Hence the Visual aspect) and this one is so all over the place between backgrounds and the rather good CG images, to the point where I find it hard to give it a solid score.
4-5/10

MusicI admit, the music is easily the best part of this game. Almost all of the tracks are soothing and fit well within the context of the game. Sienna and the music are the only 2 truly reddeming qualities about this game.

YuriI admit, i'm sort of a snob when it comes to my yuri, so expect this to be very critical.
The yuri in this is very...forced. In order for yuri to achieve it's full emotional effect, you have to be invested in the characters BEFORE they officially fall in love. You need to care about these two people for it to matter. I found no reason to like this couple because Azure is so boring I simply didn't care and Sienna didn't get enough time to really develop as a character all that much. Though I like Sienna, I still couldn't care about their relationship because I didn't get the time to know Sienna and Azure was to boring for me to care.
In terms of the quality of the yuri 2/10
in terms of quantity of yuri 9/10

Sex SceneI feel like this is what everyone was waiting for, but expect to be critical about this as well.
The writing for this is ,surprisingly, very good. But it's a little TOO good. What do I mean by this? The writing for this scene is descriptive, uses words no one really thinks of, and does it's job well. The issue is that the writing doesn't match up with the rest of the game. The rest of isn't very descriptive and uses plain words. It perplexes me how different the writing is between the story and this sex scene. Quite frankly, it's painfully obvious what they put all their time and effort into.
7/10

Spoiler section!So the story starts with our main character, Azure, in class being bored. She leves class early, goes home, and gets scolded by her father. In order to advance the plot, she sneaks out on a school night and just sorta walks. She gets lost and comes across a box with a ring in it. She puts on the ring and gets home right when she has to leave for school. She finds an empty classroom and takes a nap. Whens he wakes up, we get the first appearence of the only character with any personality, Sienna. Sienna is the current queen of mars and because Azure put the ring on, she is engaged to Sienna. Sienna gives her the option to go with her to Mars, or stay on Earth. Azure mopes about the next day thinking about Sienna's offer. She, of course, accepts. Sex scene happens. Then they leave to Mars and it just ends. After the credits you get a screen with more good CG involving the two mains (SFW). The speak of a story that sounds alot more interesting then this and it ends for real.


So, what do I think of this overall? Quite frankly, this is one of the worse examples of how to do Yuri. If you're new to the genre, this is not what most if it is. This was an excuse to put something with sex in it undert the guise of a game. I'm all for promoting games like these, don't get me wrong. But they need to be done BETTER. A better story, better characters, better art. All of their time went into developing a sex scene and not much else. If you follow Yuri as much as I do, you'll know that Kindred Spirits on the Rooftop is eventually coming to Steam in an uncensored version. I can't wait for that day, as I know that it will be done RIGHT and will promote Yuri in a somewhat good way.

Final Score:5/10In closing, it's free, won't take up much of your time. I worry this game will make valve think twice about alowing 18+ games on steam. It far from a good example, though I have seen much worse before. They did not quite know who they were trying to target with this, but then again, I don't think they cared. it's free.
